comments.body:
There is a bit of inconsistency here:
* the CLI option uses `crt` for certificate
* The validation error uses `Public key file`
* And the long text says X509 certificate file

Should this file contain the certificate or the public key?
I don't know what would be more common to "encounter" in the wild.

I have renamed the method name and some strings to be more consistent.

As to which one is more common. I have no actual experience with this, but here is what the internet has told me:

There are several common formats that include RSA key information:
- [PKCS#1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PKCS_1): contains public key information
- [X.509](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X.509): contains public key information and also additional info like issuer or a signature of the public key
- [PKCS#8](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PKCS_8): contains private key information

There are two ways to serialize the above:
- [DER](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X.690#DER_encoding), a binary format
- [PEM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Privacy-Enhanced_Mail), a text format. Basically a base64 encoded version of a DER file, with a header of the form:
  - `----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----` for X.509 data (`Certificate` structure)
  - `----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY----` for X.509 data (`SubjectPublicKeyInfo` structure, which is [a subset of the above](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X.509#Structure_of_a_certificate))
  - `----BEGIN RSA PUBLIC KEY----` for PKCS#1 data
  - `----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY----` for PKCS#8 data
  - [... a dozen other things](https://stackoverflow.com/a/5356351/2289701)

File extensions [tell you very little about the content of the file](https://support.ssl.com/Knowledgebase/Article/View/19/0/der-vs-crt-vs-cer-vs-pem-certificates-and-how-to-convert-them).

Currently, the `--auth-jwt-rs256-crt` sandbox option supports X.509 (the `Certificate` kind, not the `SubjectPublicKeyInfo` kind) in both PEM and DER encoding.
Thanks ðŸ‘

comments.body:
an alternative and less involved way of doing this would be:

```
val knownLevels = Set("ERROR", "WARN", "INFO", "DEBUG", "TRACE")
// ...
opt[String]("log-level")
      .optional()
      .validate(l => if (knownLevels.contains(l.toUpperCase) success else failure(s"Unrecogized logging level $l"))
      .action((level, c) => c.copy(logLevel = Level.toLevel(level.toUpperCase)))
```
@gerolf-da Is this a request to change it? I do not have strong preference here. Happy to make it both ways.
Sorry for being unclear. Yes, please change it. After that I'm ðŸ‘
Please change the SandboxFixture part where this one is still used. Also, please add a test case in `CliSpec`!
the `SandboxFixture` uses the config directly. I've amended `CliSpec`.
